intro: Hieracium galbanatum, commonly known as galbanum hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. The plant has yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically hairy and lobed. It produces a milky sap that is often toxic to livestock. Hieracium galbanatum is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
